headline.main: Higher Risk of Strokes in South Is Linked to Dietary Differences

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Natl Health Institute study of 50,000 ex-Harvard and Penna Univ students finds smoking 10 or more cigarettes a day increases risk of fatal heart disease 62%
docs.lead_paragraph: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 24 -- High blood pressure, cigarette smoking and obesity are known to raise cardiovascular disease risks among Americans, and today a Federal survey added another: geography.
docs.snippet: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 24 -- High blood pressure, cigarette smoking and obesity are known to raise cardiovascular disease risks among Americans, and today a Federal survey added another: geography.
